title: de-way: empowering ideas
description: A platform is required to unite retail investors and entrepreneurs together to have an idea implemented with transparency and governance.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is in line with the Fund 6 Dapps and Integrations.  It is proposing to create a Catalyst like Dap for matching Entrepreneurs with investors.  Where as Catalyst uses a community fund, this proposal seeks to build investment pools from private individuals/venture capitalists.
f6_assessments.q1: The idea presented is good, if this team does not build it I am sure it will be built eventually.  The plan is not overly detailed which detracts in the sense of assessing it's viability.  I would like to see some bullet points showing a breakdown of costs and some milestones along the roadmap.  There is no prototype so we are at the very early stages of development.  $40,000 USD requested seems a reasonable to get the project off the ground.
f6_assessments.q2: Key Performance Indicators are not defined in the proposal.  The budget breakdown is brief but ok.  However it is going to difficult for a 3rd party to gauge progress without milestones being given at the 3, 6 and 12 month intervals mentioned in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal matches the challenge, as it's a decentralized application that enables entrepreneurs to realize their idea. Another thing I like is that this is the perfect time for such a platform to impact the community.
f6_assessments.q1:
There are lacking credentials of the aforementioned team. Just to put things in perspective, as long as there isn't any proof of combined 45 years of experience, these are just words that have no weight behind them. I'd suggest to the proposer, to put some links that will justify those words as other proposers are already doing and linking their linked in profiles or the companies they plan on hiring or any other kind of proof.
One thing I like is the whole process will be audited and community-driven, but I don't see any cons for the entrepreneurs, unlike the lenders (might lose money or the auditors who can be slashed) which seems a bit unfair. I think some more thought can be put in about the balance of the roles and the power that each role will have so real governance is present.
The roadmap is a bit broad, but this can be overlooked for the lack of experience in making proposals. 
The budget breakdown can be done a lot better by giving a breakdown of hiring costs and renting costs.
f6_assessments.q2:
Since there aren't any links of repositories or real people that can be checked or audited I find it difficult to say there is sufficient information to audit the progress of the solution. As a suggestion for the proposer, I'd say to put themselves in the shoes of a community member that wants to follow the progress of the implementation. A blog post with hard data or another progress update by the project managers or devs would really help in that regard. 
Another thing missing is KPIs, which can be really helpful if you're serious and result-driven.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal identifies a gap in the traditional funding modal I think it's smart to use stablecoins as the preferred payment method given that the price fluctuations in volatility of ADA may prove to be a hinderence to the businesses getting the funding.

The proposal also mentions an ICO - does it intend to launch as a registered security as most ICOs likely will be categorised at some point as securities. Perhaps this would be better suited as an IDO? (Initial Decentralized Exchange Offering) where there is less regulatory bodies to worry about.
f6_assessments.q1:
I would like to know more about the team, without that it's truly difficult to see the resumes of the people behind the project and say with what probability this proposal will successfully implement it's roadmap as defined.

I trust that your team has 45 years between you in the IT industry, but a LinkedIn or Github link may help to lend credibility to catalyst voters.

Also, the ICO preparation is mentioned at 6 months, but when does it actually take place? More detail is needed.
f6_assessments.q2:
I think the roadmap needs more work, it is rather vague and kid of leaves voter guessing at the moment.

i.e. "Platform marketing" - Voters would like to see some hard KPIs to measure how successful said marketing is. as in x,xxx followers on twitter/facebook etc. 

Also, normally proposals that get funded break the MVP launch into components.

i.e. frontend complete - 3 months, backend complete - 6 months, full production launch - 12 months.

solution: A community-funded treasury to empower the entrepreneurs who are governed by contributors.  Ideas will be tokenised for easy exchange.
experience: We are experienced developers, DevOps engineers & cyber security expert with combined experience of 45 years in IT industry.
